description:
This table enables you to report on medications ordered in EpicCare or Ambulatory Pharmacy (Prescriptions).





This table should be used with ORDER_MED.

columns.name: ORDER_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the order record associated with this medication order. This is an internal unique identifier for order records in this table and cannot be used to link to CLARITY_MEDICATION.

columns.name: TXT_AUTHPROV_NAME
columns.description: In ambulatory pharmacy, a prescription order could be authorized by a non-EpicCare provider. There is no provider record for this provider. This is used to store the non-EpicCare provider's name.

columns.name: TXT_AUTHPROV_DEA
columns.description: In ambulatory pharmacy, a prescription order could be authorized by a non-EpicCare provider. There is no provider record for this provider. This is used to store the non-EpicCare provider's Dynamic Epic Advisory Database (DEA) number.

columns.name: TXT_AUTHPROV_PHONE
columns.description: In ambulatory pharmacy, a prescription order could be authorized by a non-EpicCare provider. There is no provider record for this provider. This is used to store the non-EpicCare provider's phone number.

columns.name: TXT_AUTHPROV_FAX
columns.description: In ambulatory pharmacy, a prescription order could be authorized by a non-EpicCare provider. There is no provider record for this provider. This is used to store the non-EpicCare provider's fax number.

columns.name: TXT_AUTHPROV_STREET
columns.description: In ambulatory pharmacy, a prescription order could be authorized by a non-EpicCare provider. There is no provider record for this provider. This is used to store the non-EpicCare provider's street address information.

columns.name: TXT_AUTHPROV_CITY
columns.description: In ambulatory pharmacy, a prescription order could be authorized by a non-EpicCare provider. There is no provider record for this provider. This is used to store the non-EpicCare provider's city.

columns.name: TXT_AUTHPROV_ZIP
columns.description: In ambulatory pharmacy, a prescription order could be authorized by a non-EpicCare provider. There is no provider record for this provider. This is used to store the non-EpicCare provider's zip code.

columns.name: RX_NUM_FORMATTED
columns.description: The formatted prescription number for the order.

columns.name: RX_COMMENTS
columns.description: In an ambulatory pharmacy, the person who enters the prescription into the system can add additional comments to the prescription. The comments are not part of the order and are used for pharmacy internal communication only. The comments do not affect the patient instructions, nor the dispense information.

columns.name: RX_WRITTEN_DATE
columns.description: Store the prescription written date, which is the date the prescription was entered into the system through EpicCare, or the date the prescription was written to the paper prescription.

columns.name: MED_DISCONT_ENC
columns.description: *** Deprecated *** The data in this column does not correctly link to PAT_ENC.PAT_ENC_DATE_REAL. ORDER_MED_5.DISCON_PAT_ENC_DATE_REAL should be used for this link instead. ******

columns.name: EFQ_OVRD_DAY_TYPE
columns.description: Specifies what the numeric values in the frequency override days columns represent. If it is 1 then the listed days are relative days. If it is 2 then the listed days are weekdays. Any other value has no meaning.

columns.name: EFQ_OVRD_CYCL_LEN
columns.description: If there is a frequency override specified, this item will contain the length of a relative specified type cycle. For all other specified types this value will be ignored (and should be empty).

columns.name: CHART_CORRECTION_ID
columns.description: For chart corrections, links the order to a Chart Correction Audit (CCA) record.

columns.name: PARENT_CE_ORDER_ID
columns.description: When a cross-encounter order is released, this item stores the ID of the parent order.

columns.name: TPL_WT_SRC_C_NAME
columns.description:
The weight source of the treatment plan for this order, as of the time the order is signed.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Treatment plan weight


Past measured weight


Most current measured weight (actual)


Ideal body weight


Adjusted body weight


User entered weight


Lean body weight


Dosing weight


Other

columns.name: OVERRIDE_LINKED_C_NAME
columns.description:
The linked override resolved category number for the medication order. The category indicates whether the admins in the override pull are all linked to pharmacy orders. 


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Resolved


Do not link

columns.name: CONDITIONAL_C_NAME
columns.description:
Identifies an inpatient order as "conditional". 


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


No


Yes


Yes - Initiated


Force No Condition

columns.name: COND_STATUS_C_NAME
columns.description:
For a conditional order, indicates whether the conditions for the order have been satisfied yet.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Conditions not met


All conditions met

columns.name: PEND_REF_REAS_COMM
columns.description: Extracts the comment attached to the pend refusal reason (I ORD 7706)

columns.name: PRIORITIZED_INST_TM
columns.description: The time and date that is used as the prioritized date.

columns.name: ORDER_QUESN_LIST
columns.description: The order specific questions that are listed in the order composer for the order.

columns.name: EXT_PHARM_MED_NAME
columns.description: Medication display name received from an external pharmacy.

columns.name: PEND_MED_ACTIVE_YN
columns.description:
A flag to determine if this is an active pending medication or not.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Yes


No

columns.name: PEND_PREV_ORD_ID
columns.description: The previous order ID for the pending medication. This item is NOT networked to orders.

columns.name: TXT_AUTHPROV_NPI
columns.description: If the authorizing provider for a medication is not currently an Epic provider (no SER record for this provider), free text provider items are used to save information about this provider. This item stores the National Provider ID (NPI) of the provider.

columns.name: ORD_TRANS_METHOD_C_NAME
columns.description:
This item holds the method of transmission for a given order. It should only be set from within an order transmittal rule using the transmission method property (LRC 161).


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Printed


Faxed


E-Prescribed


Mail Ordered


Phoned In


OTC


Vended


Internal Pharmacy

columns.name: PROFILE_ONLY_RX_YN
columns.description:
This item specifies whether the medication order is intended to be filled by the pharmacy immediately or should be filled later when requested by the patient. This flag can be set in order entry based on the order class or by selecting the 'profile only' checkbox in pharmacy order entry.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


No


Yes

columns.name: DISP_QTY_REM
columns.description: Stores the remaining authorized quantity (in Written Dispense Quantity unit) that the pharmacist can dispense. It is used in Ambulatory Pharmacy to calculate the Refills Remaining.

columns.name: FREQ_UNSCHEDULED_C_NAME
columns.description:
If the frequency is unscheduled, this column will store a 1. If the frequency is not unscheduled, this column will be blank.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


YES

columns.name: DURATION
columns.description: Duration for this medication.

columns.name: INTERVENTION
columns.description: Intervention for this medication.

columns.name: LAST_SUSPEND_DTTM
columns.description: Instant this medication was last suspended.

columns.name: SIGN_ACTION_PEND_C_NAME
columns.description:
Sign action for pended order.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Sign


Sign & Hold

columns.name: ORIG_MED_ID
columns.description: Original prescription column; contains the medication order medication ID.

columns.name: ORIG_STRENGTH
columns.description: Original prescription column; contains the medication order strength.

columns.name: ORIG_ROUTE_C_NAME
columns.description:
Original prescription column; contains the medication order route.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: ORIG_MED_SOURCE_C_NAME
columns.description:
Original prescription column; contains the medication order source.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 No Entries Defined

columns.name: ORIG_DIS_DISP_QTY
columns.description: Original prescription column; contains the medication order discrete dispense quantity.

columns.name: ORIG_DISP_UNIT_C_NAME
columns.description:
Original prescription column; contains the medication order discrete dispense unit.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries:

columns.name: ORIG_START_DATE
columns.description: Original prescription column; contains the medication order start date.

columns.name: ORIG_END_DATE
columns.description: Original prescription column; contains the medication order end date.

columns.name: ORIG_DAW_YN
columns.description:
Original prescription column; contains the medication order 'dispense as written?' flag and is either yes or no.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: PEND_MED_ACTIVE_YN

columns.name: PENDDC_STATUS_C_NAME
columns.description:
Status of an order with regard to pending discontinue. 


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


D/C Accepted


Pending D/C


D/C Rejected

columns.name: MED_DISC_REFILLS
columns.description: Saves the discrete medication refills information for the order.

columns.name: BACK_DATED_YN
columns.description:
Indicates whether the order was back-dated at the time the start date was entered


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: PEND_MED_ACTIVE_YN

columns.name: RX_CLINICALLY_RV_YN
columns.description:
This specifies whether the prescription has been clinically reviewed by a pharmacist. Clinical review can either be required to occur before a prescription is filled or after it is filled during fill verification.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: PROFILE_ONLY_RX_YN

columns.name: PRIORITIZED_UTC_DTTM
columns.description: Stores the prioritized instant for the result in UTC
